algorithm_technique: Count primes using Sieve of Eratosthenes, then calculate permutations of primes and non-primes.
problem_summary_simple: Count permutations where primes are at prime indices and non-primes at non-prime indices.
problem_summary_technical: Count primes up to n. Calculate factorial of prime count and factorial of non-prime count, then multiply modulo 10^9 + 7.
key_insights: The problem decomposes into arranging primes in prime positions and non-primes in non-prime positions independently.
The Sieve of Eratosthenes is efficient for finding primes up to a given limit.
Factorials are used to count the permutations of the prime and non-prime numbers.
